It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, such as forest understories, where it thrives in partial to full shade. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
